channel.title: Approach for creating a presentation app
channel.description:
How would you go about creating a basic, simple, presentation application? Something like powerpoint but dumbed down a lot.
I'm doing this as a small project in C# (even though I actually have to study for my exams right now) and I'd like to know how others would approach it?
Oh and btw, is my first sentence correct? I'm not sure about the 'how would you go about..' and I have an English exam tomorrow.. :d

item.title: Approach for creating a presentation app
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

First of all, thank you for answering (:
Second, like Arcik said, I want to create a powerpoint-like-application.
I just want to know how others would do this…

Right now, I’m creating a program that reads a textfile (see below), puts everything in a list and then draws everything on the form.
A panel per slide is created and all the objects on the slide are created on the panel representing the slide.
Textfile:

[code]
[properties]
[slides=‘2’]
[size=(400,400)]
[/properties]

[slides]
[slide=1]
[objects(2)]
[class=‘textbox’ name=‘NameOfTheTextbox’ text=‘Some random text’ size=(40,30) point=(0,0)]
[class=‘textbox’ name=‘textbox4’ text=‘This is a sentence.’ size=(40,30) point=(0,30)]
[/objects]
[/slide]
[slide=2]
[objects(2)]
[class=‘textbox’ name=‘textbox100’ text=’…’ size=(40,30) point=(0,0)]
[class=‘textbox’ name=‘textbox444’ text=‘Snow_’ size=(40,30) point=(0,30)]
[/objects]
[/slide]
[/slides][/code]
When I’m done with this, I’ll create something that allows you to create such textfiles more easily, with a GUI.
